title: Aura
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Auras** are passive abilities that emanate out of certain characters and monsters, affecting anything that comes within their range. The exact effect this has varies by aura.

## Contents

- [1 Halo](#Halo)
- [2 Umbra](#Umbra)
- [3 Ring of Flames](#Ring_of_Flames)
- [4 Polar Vortex](#Polar_Vortex)
- [5 Silence](#Silence)
- [6 History](#History)

## Halo

Halo auras emanate forth from certain holy weapons, monsters, and characters. It has the following effects:

- Negates [invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility") of anything inside.
- Makes everything inside easier to hit. Attackers gain `1 + 1d8` [to-hit](/To-hit "To-hit") against anything inside. However, when players emit a halo, they aren't any easier to hit.
- Players have their [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") reduced by a factor of x40%.

**Sources:**

- Worshipers of [the Shining One](/The_Shining_One "The Shining One") receive a halo with range based on [piety](/Piety "Piety") (very small to nearly your entire [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight"))
- Characters wielding an [orb of light](/Light "Light") or the unrand artifact morningstar [Eos](/Eos "Eos") receive a medium halo.
- [Wu Jian](/Wu_Jian "Wu Jian")'s Heavenly Storm causes a 2-tile halo for its duration.
- Most [holy monsters](/List_of_holy_monsters "List of holy monsters") have halos, the size of which depends on the monster in question. Weaker creatures like [holy swine](/Holy_swine "Holy swine") and [sun moths](/Sun_moth "Sun moth") have tiny halos while powerful creatures like [seraphim](/Seraph "Seraph") and [ophanim](/Ophan "Ophan") have extremely large halos.

## Umbra

The opposite of a halo, umbras emanate forth from unholy angelic beings. It has the following effects:

- Reduces the accuracy of all within the aura. [Demons](/Demon "Demon"), [undead](/Undead "Undead"), and worshippers of [Dithmenos](/Dithmenos "Dithmenos") and [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul") are immune to this effect.
- When players emit an umbra, their [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") increases by a factor dependent on source. ×1.5 for the [ring of Shadows](/Ring_of_Shadows "Ring of Shadows"), ×1.0 to ×2.0 (depending on piety) for Dithmenos worshippers.
- Allows use of Dithmenos' Shadow Step ability.
- Negates the effect of any halo they overlap with.

**Sources:**

- [Profane servitors](/Profane_servitor "Profane servitor") have a large umbra.
- Wearers of the [ring of Shadows](/Ring_of_Shadows "Ring of Shadows") have a medium umbra.
- Worshipers of [Dithmenos](/Dithmenos "Dithmenos") receive an umbra with range based on piety (very small to your entire line of sight)

## Ring of Flames

The [Ring of Flames](/Ring_of_Flames "Ring of Flames") emanates one tile all around their source, creating [flame clouds](/Flame_cloud "Flame cloud"). These clouds linger for a few turns even after the source moves away. It has the following effects:

- Negates any [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic") that strikes the clouds.
- Deals [fire](/Fire "Fire") damage to anything standing in the clouds (but does not injure the source).

**Sources:**

- Players can wear the [salamander hide armour](/Salamander_hide_armour "Salamander hide armour") to gain this aura.
- [Asmodeus](/Asmodeus "Asmodeus") has a permanent Ring of Flames aura surrounding him.

## Polar Vortex

The [Polar Vortex](/Polar_Vortex "Polar Vortex") aura emanates when you cast the spell of the same name. It has the following effects:

- Deals heavy, partially irresistible cold damage to everything (except the source) within the aura.
- Moves all affected targets (monsters, items, clouds, etc.) counterclockwise around the source each turn.

**Sources:**

- Players and monsters can cast the spell to temporarily gain this aura.
- [Diamond obelisks](/Diamond_obelisk "Diamond obelisk") and [twisters](/Twister "Twister") have permanent Polar Vortex auras surrounding them.

## Silence

When [Silence](/Silence "Silence") auras emanate from a monster or the player, most creatures within the aura lose the ability to make any noise, including speech. This prevents:

- Reading scrolls
- Casting spells (all spells for the player)
- Using [divine](/God "God") abilities
- [Shouting](/T "T")

Monsters are unable to use spells/abilities with the "Wizard", "Divine", or "Vocal" [spell slot flags](/Spell_slot_flag "Spell slot flag"). Monsters can use "Magical" or "Natural" abilities in silence (most [demons](/Demon "Demon") use "Magical" abilities, for instance).

When players emit the aura, their [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") is reduced by 50.

**Sources:**

- Players can cast the [Silence](/Silence "Silence") spell or use a [scroll of silence](/Scroll_of_silence "Scroll of silence") to temporarily gain this aura.

The following enemies cast Silence:

- & [![Ereshkigal.png](/images/a/a8/Ereshkigal.png)](/File:Ereshkigal.png) **[Ereshkigal](/Ereshkigal "Ereshkigal")**
- A [![Mennas.png](/images/b/b6/Mennas.png)](/File:Mennas.png) **[Mennas](/Mennas "Mennas")**

The following enemies may be able to cast Silence, depending on their spell set:

- & [![Pandemonium lord.png](/images/c/c6/Pandemonium_lord.png)](/File:Pandemonium_lord.png) **[Pandemonium lord](/Pandemonium_lord "Pandemonium lord")** (7.5% chance)

The following enemy inherently radiates Silence:

- W [![Silent spectre.png](/images/b/b1/Silent_spectre.png)](/File:Silent_spectre.png) **[Silent spectre](/Silent_spectre "Silent spectre")** (as a permanent 12-tile aura, whether awake or [dormant](/Dormant "Dormant"))

## History

- In [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), [Tornado](/Tornado "Tornado") was replaced with the cold themed, functionally similar [Polar Vortex](/Polar_Vortex "Polar Vortex").
- In [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), the [Ring of Flames](/Ring_of_Flames "Ring of Flames") spell and aura is now triggered by the [salamander hide armour](/Salamander_hide_armour "Salamander hide armour").
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), [Powered by Death](/Powered_by_Death "Powered by Death") gave regeneration from nearby corpses, relying on an aura to do so.
- The [Moth of suppression](/Moth_of_suppression "Moth of suppression") and [Suppression](/Suppression "Suppression") auras were added in [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), and removed in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14").
